spanish_meaning: correr con otro, como en una carrera o competencia.
english_meaning: to run with someone, as in a race or competition

spanish_meaning: atrapar con ambas manos (por ejemplo, una gallina).
english_meaning: to catch with both hands (for example, a hen).

spanish_meaning: colocar algo sobre otra cosa formando una pila; colocar la mano sobre un objeto para aplastarlo o apretarlo.
english_meaning: to place something on top of another thing forming a pile; to place one's hand over an object to crush it or squeeze it

spanish_meaning: pelearse dos o más hombres usando las manos, con la intención de tumbarse.
english_meaning: for two or more men fight using their hands, with the intention of knocking one another down.
to run chasing someone.
to belch.

spanish_meaning: chancar huaca (arbusto venenoso) para ir a pescar.
english_meaning: to grind huaca (venomous bush) for fishing.

spanish_meaning: bostezar, abriendo la boca casi totalmente.
english_meaning: to yawn, opening the mouth almost completely.
for two people to kiss each other passionately.

spanish_meaning: forma verbal que se usa como interjección con el valor de “no todavía, no quiero”. Por ejemplo, cuando te ofrecen comida.
english_meaning: verbal form that one uses as an interjection with the meaning of “no more, I don’t want it.” For example, when food is offered to you

spanish_meaning: forma verbal que se usa como interjección con el valor de “!para, no hagas eso!”.
english_meaning: verbal form that one uses as an interjection with the meaning of “stop, don’t do this!”
to make, manufacture.
to hit with the foot; kick
to eat quickly, chocking on oneself.

spanish_meaning: enjuagarse la boca fuertemente y haciendo gárgaras.
english_meaning: to rinse out the mouth strongly and by gargling anaka

spanish_meaning: vomitar; refiere tanto a vómitos producidos por una enfermedad como a los producidos intencionalmente como parte de un tratamiento médico tradicional.
english_meaning: to vomit; refers to vomit produced both by sickness and that which is produced intentionally as a part of traditional medical treatment.

spanish_meaning: nombrar; ponerle nombre a una persona o a una mascota.
english_meaning: to name, to give a name on a person or a pet.

spanish_meaning: bajar un objeto parecido a una olla o una tinaja.
english_meaning: to lower an object similar to a pot or an earthenware jar.
to open the mouth completely.

spanish_meaning: rajarse la madera por efectos del clima.
english_meaning: for wood to come apart due to effects of the weather.
to sneeze.

spanish_meaning: desmayarse; perder el conocimiento (a causa de un ataque epiléptico o un desvanecimiento, por ejemplo).
english_meaning: to pass out; to lose consciousness (because of a seizure or fainting, for example).
to drink
to whisper, to talk in the ear

spanish_meaning: dar a luz, parir (tanto personas como animales).
english_meaning: to give birth (for both people and animals).

spanish_meaning: oscurecerse el cielo de manera inesperada porque va a llover.
english_meaning: An unexpected darkening of the sky because it’s going to rain.

spanish_meaning: hablar; hacer ruido (los animales o las cosas).
plantar un árbol o arbusto a partir de una rama pequeña.
english_meaning: to talk; to make noise (animals or things).
to plant a tree or a bush from a small branch.

spanish_meaning: conversar entre dos para llegar un acuerdo sobre algo.
english_meaning: for two to converse in order to arrive at an agreement about something.

spanish_meaning: salir el sol por la mañana; amanecer.
english_meaning: for the sun to rise in the morning; to get light.

spanish_meaning: ocultarse el sol por la tarde; anochecer.
english_meaning: for the sun to hide in the afternoon; to get dark, dusk

spanish_meaning: despejarse el cielo y salir el sol después de llover.
english_meaning: for the sky to clear up and the sun to rise after raining.
to put something out in the sun or to bleach.
to rot (fruits, meat, fish, etc.)

spanish_meaning: sacudirse un animal con la intención de secarse.
english_meaning: for an animal to shake with the intention of drying itself.

spanish_meaning: endulzar algo, en especial una bebida.
english_meaning: to sweeten something, especially a drink.

spanish_meaning: ir adelante, como dirigiendo un grupo.
english_meaning: to go forward, as directing a group.

spanish_meaning: lavarse el área que cubre la cara (incluyendo los ojos y la frente).
english_meaning: to wash the area that covers the face. (including the eyes and the forehead).
to have a fever
to scratch someone.
to bring something; for several to come together.

spanish_meaning: mirarse la cara. Por ejemplo, mirarse la cara en un espejo.
english_meaning: to look at one’s face. For example, to look at one’s face in the mirror.

spanish_meaning: hacer cosquillas en alguna parte del cuerpo a alguien.
english_meaning: to tickle some part of the body of someone.
to look for something
to wake up.
to stand up and leave

spanish_meaning: desviarse de un camino; perderse en el monte.
english_meaning: to turn off of a path; to be lost in the forest.

spanish_meaning: sentarse dos personas, una en frente de la otra.
english_meaning: for two people to sit, one in front of the other.

spanish_meaning: sentarse dos personas, una al costado de otra.
english_meaning: for two people to sit, one on the side of the other.

spanish_meaning: palmear a alguien en la frente.
english_meaning: to pat someone on the forehead.

spanish_meaning: pintar la cara con una pasta producida a partir del fruto del achiote (Bixa orellana L.)
english_meaning: to paint one’s face with the paste produced from the fruit of the achiote (Bixa orellana L.)

spanish_meaning: sentirse inestable físicamente, como a punto de perder el conocimiento; marearse.
english_meaning: to feel unsteady physically, as on the point of losing consciousness, to feel ill

spanish_meaning: cubrir algo con una manta o un objeto similar.
english_meaning: to cover something with a blanket or a similar object.
to blink repeatedly.
to be with closed eyes
to be seated.
to sit.

spanish_meaning: coger algo con las manos; comprar.
english_meaning: to take something with the hands; to buy
to take something from someone.
to slip, to lose balance.
to take something and leave, to steal.
to illuminate, ignite a torch.
to laugh
to brush.

spanish_meaning: sancochar, cocinar algo (como carne por ejemplo) hasta que quede muy suave.
english_meaning: to parboil, to cook something (like meat for example) until it is left very soft.

spanish_meaning: lavarse la cabeza y el cabello.
english_meaning: to wash one’s head and hair.
for one’s hair to turn grey.
to cut the bangs of someone.
To cut one’s own bangs.
to put something above, to climb
to treat a wound.
to take something; to go between several
to chew
to be very hot.
to smoke, to spread the smoke.

spanish_meaning: tener hambre o antojo de comer cualquier cosa que no sea carne, como por ejemplo plátano o yuca.
english_meaning: to be hungry or craving food of any type that isn’t meat, like for example banana or yucca

spanish_meaning: pelar la cáscara dura de un fruto.
english_meaning: to peel the hard skin of a fruit.

spanish_meaning: llenar un recipiente con una sustancia líquida.
english_meaning: to fill a container with a liquid substance.
to lower.

spanish_meaning: bajar un cerro o una loma.
english_meaning: to fall down a hill

spanish_meaning: crujir un objeto; por ejemplo, la madera.
english_meaning: to beat, crush an object; for example, wood.

spanish_meaning: chancar algo con una piedra hasta molerlo o destruirlo.
english_meaning: to grind something with a stone until wearing it down or destroying it.
to give a nickname to somebody

spanish_meaning: clavar o machetear varias veces; picotear un pájaro.
english_meaning: to hammer or cut many times; for a bird to peck.

spanish_meaning: abrir las piernas mientras se está echado.
english_meaning: to open one’s legs while they are lying down.

spanish_meaning: seguir o rastrear a una persona o animal.
english_meaning: to chase or to follow the trail of a person or an animal.
to be sick with diarrhea.
to be tired, lazy.
to fall behind, to stay behind.
to go behind.

spanish_meaning: colgar algo de ambos lados, a manera de una hamaca.
english_meaning: to hang something on both sides, as of a hammock.
to scratch someone

spanish_meaning: rascarle a alguien produciendo ruido; sacarle las escamas a un pescado.
english_meaning: to scratch someone producing noise; to take the scales off a fish.
to scrape one’s own body.
to wash something, to bathe something.
to take a bath.

spanish_meaning: moler algo hasta dejarlo hecho pedacitos.
english_meaning: to grind something, leaving it in little pieces.
to run.
to have sexual relations with someone.
to complain of some pain.

spanish_meaning: quedarse quieto, dejar de moverse o de trabajar.
english_meaning: to stay still, stop moving or working.
to make someone happy, to be content.
to live, reside in a place

spanish_meaning: acostumbrarse a estar en un lugar; vivir en un solo lugar por muchos años.
english_meaning: to get used to a place; to live in only one place for many years.

spanish_meaning: jalar algo. Por ejemplo, jalar una cuerda o una planta para cosecharla.
english_meaning: to pull something. For example, to pull a rope or a plant for harvesting it.

spanish_meaning: andar de rama en rama como lo hacen los monos.
english_meaning: to walk from branch to branch as monkeys do.
To become a little dark.

spanish_meaning: hacer sonar algo, como las envolturas de los alimentos cuando están arrugadas.
english_meaning: for something to make noise, like the packaging of food when it is wrinkled.
to feel hot

spanish_meaning: fatigarse o agitarse debido a un esfuerzo físico muy prolongado.
english_meaning: To become fatigued or agitated due to a very prolonged physical effort.
to find something.
to pull something.
to cut something.

spanish_meaning: trozar o cortar algo varias veces de arriba hacia abajo.
english_meaning: to break or cut something various times above or below.

spanish_meaning: comer algo de golpe, sin masticarlo bien, tragándolo.
english_meaning: to eat something all at once, without chewing it well, swallowing it
to smile.
dekernal.

spanish_meaning: arder el fuego o la candela.
english_meaning: to burn fire or a candle.

spanish_meaning: cerrar un espacio, tapar una madriguera o hueco.
english_meaning: to close a space, to cover a cave or hollow.
to put out (the fire)

spanish_meaning: abrir; por ejemplo, puertas, botellas u ollas.
english_meaning: to open; for example, doors, bottles or bowls.

spanish_meaning: cerrar; por ejemplo, puertas, botellas u ollas.
english_meaning: to close, for example, doors, bottles or bowls.

spanish_meaning: perforar, hacerle un hueco a algo.
english_meaning: to drill, to make a hole in something

spanish_meaning: seguir con ganas de comer, no estar saciado.
english_meaning: to continue with the desire of eating, not being satiated.

spanish_meaning: oler u olfatear; acercar el rostro al rostro de otra persona; besar.
english_meaning: to smell or sniff; to move one’s face closer to the face of another person; to kiss.
for two people to kiss

spanish_meaning: hacer un tejido con hojas de palma para construir el techo de una casa; coser o zurcir una prenda de vestir o un pedazo de tela; tejer con lana.
english_meaning: to make a knitting with palm leaves for constructing the roof of a house; to sew or mend a garment or a piece of fabric; to weave with wool.
to laugh.
to whistle, to make the water run
to scratch oneself or to scratch someone.
to breathe.
to cry.
to roast, to smoke.
to strongly rain.

spanish_meaning: pelar algo, por ejemplo una fruta.
english_meaning: to peel something, for example a fruit.
to breast-feed.
to blow.
to caress someone.

spanish_meaning: acariciarse el cuerpo, como haciéndose cariño a uno mismo.
english_meaning: to stroke the body, as taking care of oneself.

spanish_meaning: cargar un bulto sobre la espalda.
english_meaning: to carry a package on one’s back.
to insult someone

spanish_meaning: ahuyentar o espantar con las manos; por ejemplo, una mosca.
english_meaning: to chase away or scare away with the hands; for example, a fly.
to be.
to be cold.

spanish_meaning: cargar un bulto con los brazos.
english_meaning: to carry a package with one’s arms
to lose weight.
to spill blood
for a woman to menstruate.
to climb, to scale.

spanish_meaning: entrar a un lugar; hundirse, sumergirse en el agua.
english_meaning: to enter a place; to sink, to submerge oneself in water.

spanish_meaning: hundir, sumergir algo o a alguien.
english_meaning: to sink, submerge something or someone.

spanish_meaning: criar a un animal como una mascota, haciéndolo manso y dócil.
english_meaning: to care for an animal as a pet, making it docile
to be hidden.
to hide, hide oneself.
to be thirsty.
to compose or repair something.
to roast bananas on the grill.
To sweat.
to urinate.
to wake up.
to wake someone up.

spanish_meaning: extender, tender. Por ejemplo, un pedazo de tela, hojas de palmera, etc.
english_meaning: to spread out, to lay out. For example, to a piece of fabric, palm leaves, etc.

spanish_meaning: agriarse algo. Por ejemplo, la comida.
english_meaning: to sour something. For example, food.

spanish_meaning: eructar con un sabor agrio que llega a la boca, relacionado con la acidez estomacal.
english_meaning: to burp with a sour taste that comes to the mouth, related to stomach acid.
to choose or pick between various.

spanish_meaning: partir algo en dos partes más o menos equivalentes, por ejemplo, un tronco o una sandía.
english_meaning: to divide something in two parts more or less equivalent, for example, a log or a watermellon.
to go.

spanish_meaning: salir de un lugar o de un escondite, por ejemplo, cuando un pueblo aislado ha salido de la selva o del monte y ha empezado a vivir en una comunidad.
english_meaning: to leave a place or a hideout, for example, when isolated people have left the jungle and started to live in a community.

spanish_meaning: tener encorvado el cuerpo, como un anciano.
english_meaning: to have one’s body stooped over, as an elderly.

spanish_meaning: fallar un disparo cuando se está cazando un animal.
english_meaning: to miss a shot when one is hunting an animal.

spanish_meaning: relampaguear el cielo durante una tormenta.
english_meaning: for the sky to flash with ligthening during a storm.

spanish_meaning: preparar una sopa espesa, conocida como mazamorra en el castellano regional.
english_meaning: To prepare a thick soup, known as mazamorra (milky maize pudding) in the regional Castilian.

spanish_meaning: preparar patarashca; el proceso consiste en condimentar y cocinar el pescado envueltos en hojas en la parrilla.
english_meaning: to prepare patarashca; the process consists of seasoning and cooking the fish wrapped in leaves on the grill.

spanish_meaning: hablar mal de alguien a sus espaldas, difamar.
english_meaning: to talk back about someone behind their back, to defame

spanish_meaning: criar al hijo de otra persona como si fuera propio, adoptar.
english_meaning: to raise the child of another person as if it were one’s own, to adopt.
to call someone
to start up a fire.
to sharpen.
to be happy.
to answer, to respond.

spanish_meaning: dibujar diseños tradicionales, tanto en un pedazo de tela como en el cuerpo o el rostro.
english_meaning: to draw traditional designs, both on a piece of fabric and on the body or face.

spanish_meaning: perforar los labios para colocar un adorno tradicional.
english_meaning: to pierce the lips for hanging a traditional ornament
To lie.

spanish_meaning: hacer ruido los animales; por ejemplo, el croar de los sapos, el chirriar de los grillos o el cacarear de las gallinas.
english_meaning: for animals to make noise; for example, the croak of toads, the squeal of crickets or the cluck of hens.
to end, finish

spanish_meaning: pesar un bulto o un producto.
english_meaning: to weigh a package or a product.
to bite.
to extract pus by squeezing the skin.
to burn something.

spanish_meaning: hervir, cuando un líquido alcanza el punto de ebullición.
english_meaning: to boil, when a liquid achieves the boiling point.
to make something boil.

spanish_meaning: atorarse con una bebida, beber con demasiada rapidez.
english_meaning: to stammer with a drink, to drink too quickly.

spanish_meaning: comer fruta y otros alimentos suaves.
english_meaning: to eat fruit and other soft foods.

spanish_meaning: comer rápido, atragantarse con la comida.
english_meaning: to eat quickly, to choke oneself with food.
to spit.

spanish_meaning: forma verbal que se usa para decir gracias; literalmente significa ya lo hice, ya está hecho.
english_meaning: verbal form that one uses for thank you; literally means I already did it or it is already done.
to spin cotton.
to water.

spanish_meaning: regar campos de cultivo extensos o varias plantas.
english_meaning: to water fields of extensive farming or various plants.
to move out, to change houses.
to die, deminish.
to collapse, to be near death.

spanish_meaning: cortarse el pelo, cortar el pelo a alguien.
english_meaning: to cut one’s own hair, to cut the hair of someone
to grow.
to bury someone.
to start to go bald.
to wait for something or someone.

spanish_meaning: verter un líquido de un recipiente a otro.
english_meaning: to pour a liquid from one container to another
to lose something.
to kill.

spanish_meaning: cubrirse con algo, por ejemplo, con una colcha.
english_meaning: To cover oneself with something, for example, with a quilt.

spanish_meaning: cubrir a alguien con algo, por ejemplo, con una colcha.
english_meaning: to cover someone with something, for example, with a quilt

spanish_meaning: fijar clavos en un pedazo de madera; clavar.
english_meaning: to fasten nails to a piece of wood; to nail.
for cold wind to blow.

spanish_meaning: exprimir algo, como un limón o una naranja.
english_meaning: to wring something, as a lemon or an orange.
to sweep a space.
broom.

spanish_meaning: remedar o imitar a alguien; por ejemplo, cuando los loros imitan voces humanas.
english_meaning: to mimic or imitate somone; for example, when parrots imitate human voices.

spanish_meaning: preparar una bebida espesa usando un batidor de madera que se frota con las manos; este proceso es conocido como chapear en el castellano regional; la bebida que es resultado de este proceso es conocida como chapo.
english_meaning: to prepare a thick drink using a wood beater that one rubs with the hands; this proces is known as chapear in regional Castilian; the drink that emerges from this process is known as chapo.

spanish_meaning: tambalearse, moverse dando vueltas, como una persona mareada o borracha.
english_meaning: to stagger, to move going around in circles, as a dizzy or drunk person

spanish_meaning: dar la vuelta, desplazarse en el espacio siguiendo un rumbo casi circular.
english_meaning: to give flight, to move about in a space following an almost circular path.
to applaud.
to greet giving one’s hand.

spanish_meaning: partir algo en dos usando las manos, por ejemplo, un pan.
english_meaning: to break something in two using one’s hands, for example, bread.
to take something from someone.
to serve food.
to wash one’s hands.

spanish_meaning: arrancar algo; cultivar un campo arrancando la mala hierba con las manos; desplumar un ave antes de cocinarla.
english_meaning: to pull out something; to grow a field pulling out bad grass with one’s hands; to pluck a bird before cooking it
for a child to crawl.
to play.
to touch with one’s hands.

spanish_meaning: soltar algo que se tiene entre las manos.
english_meaning: to let something loose that one has between the hands.

spanish_meaning: extender los brazos, como queriendo dar un abrazo.
english_meaning: to extend the arms, as wanting to give a hug.

spanish_meaning: tornarse negro un plátano, quemarse o chamuscarse un objeto.
english_meaning: for a banana to become black, to burn or singe an object.

spanish_meaning: celar a alguien, particularmente a la pareja.
english_meaning: to watch over someone, particularly in a couple.
to hold someone’s hand

spanish_meaning: caminar tomadas de la mano dos personas.
english_meaning: for two people to walk drunkenly by the hand.

spanish_meaning: tomarse de la mano dos personas.
english_meaning: for two people to consume from the hand.
To mix liquids.
for a cat to meow.

spanish_meaning: embrujar a alguien; hacerle daño a una persona; malograr o descomponer algo.
english_meaning: to bewitch someone; to give someone pain; to ruin or decompose something.

spanish_meaning: meter o introducir algo en un lugar u orificio.
english_meaning: put or stick something in a place or a hole.
to give something to someone.

spanish_meaning: fastidiar a alguien, tocándolo con la punta de los dedos o hincándolo con algún objeto puntiagudo.
english_meaning: to annoy someone, touching him or her with the tip of the fingers or driving in with some sharp object

spanish_meaning: atorarse con un hueso o cualquier objeto puntiagudo.
english_meaning: to stammer with a bone or any sharp object.
to fish with a hook.
to suffer from a cramp.

spanish_meaning: tomar un puñado de algún tipo de grano.
english_meaning: to take a fistfall of some type of grain.

spanish_meaning: estar reunidos varias personas o animales; estar agrupadas varias cosas, por ejemplo, casas o libros.
english_meaning: to gather various persons or animals; for various things to be grouped, for example, houses or books
to cure someone.
to make a canoe
to shatter or fracture something.

spanish_meaning: romper o golpear algo bruscamente; moler o chancar algo hasta dejarlo hecho trizas.
english_meaning: to break or hit something suddenly; to grind or crush something until it is left in fragments.

spanish_meaning: moldear una masa con las manos hasta darle una forma esférica.
english_meaning: to mold a mass with one’s hands until it takes a spherical form.

spanish_meaning: apretar la piel de alguien con la intención de reducir una inflamación o hinchazón.
english_meaning: to squeeze the skin of someone with the intention of reducing an inflamation or a swelling.
for the stomach to hurt.
to cut smoked meat.
to bend down in a crouch.
to dream of something.

spanish_meaning: meter algo dentro de un contenedor más grande.
english_meaning: to put something inside a larger containter.
to wash plates or similar things.
to make something between two people.

spanish_meaning: arrancar un pedazo de algo con los dientes.
english_meaning: to pull out a piece of something with one’s teeth

spanish_meaning: comer carne acompañada de algo como yuca, papa, plátano o arroz.
english_meaning: to eat meat accompanied by something like yucca, potato, banana, or rice.
to cook.
to tie.
to hug
for two people to hug.
to be well hugged.
to walk.
to be on foot
for something to be piled.
to listen.

spanish_meaning: soplar fuerte el viento, produciendo ruido.
english_meaning: for the wind to blow strongly, producing noise
for the wind to blow.

spanish_meaning: soplar muy fuerte el viento, tumbando palos en medio de una tormenta.
english_meaning: for the wind to blow very strongly, knocking down sticks in the middle of a storm.
to snor.
intr. To be sad.
to love.
To arrive at a place.
to float.

spanish_meaning: sorber, produciendo un ruido con la garganta.
english_meaning: to slurp, producing a noise with the throat.
to bark at someone (a dog).
to bark (a dog).
to sleep.
to have a dream.

spanish_meaning: hacer dormir. Por ejemplo, a un bebé o a un enfermo.
english_meaning: to put to sleep. For example, a baby or a sick person
to go to bed very late, to stay up all night.
to cough.
to come.
to see, to look
to show, to teach.
to water, spill.
to let loose, spill out
to hate someone.
to know.
to teach, to educate.

spanish_meaning: estirar el cuerpo, por ejemplo, por cansancio.
english_meaning: to stretch out the body, for example, because of exhaustion.
to draw.
to sprout, bud
to go to sleep.
deflate, go flat.

spanish_meaning: sorber un líquido con una cañita.
english_meaning: to slurp a liquid with a straw
to ferment, to spoil.
to get somebody drunk, to get drunk.
for two or more people to separate.

spanish_meaning: colocar el pie sobre algo o pisarlo.
english_meaning: to put the foot above something or step on something.
to make someone fall, to fall down oneself

spanish_meaning: perforar la oreja para colocar un adorno tradicional.
english_meaning: to drill the ear to place a traditional adornment.

spanish_meaning: zapatear fuertemente en señal de ira o molestia.
english_meaning: to stomp strongly as a gesture of anger or annoyance.

spanish_meaning: sentirse nervioso, tembloroso o con miedo.
english_meaning: to feel nervous, trembling or with fear.
To make a commotion.

spanish_meaning: golpear ropa contra una piedra haciendo ruido, como cuando se lava; dar de palmazos.
english_meaning: to beat clothes against a stone making noise, as when one wash; to give smacks.
to wash clothes.
to fan, for the wind to run.
to roll, to go around in circles.

spanish_meaning: balancearse las cosas por el viento, por ejemplo, ropa u hojas; balancear, sacudir algo.
english_meaning: for things to swing in the wind, for example, close or leaves; to swing, to shake something.
to increase, to reproduce (people, animals).
to limp, to walk with difficulty

spanish_meaning: colocarse una persona detrás de la otra, como haciendo una fila.
english_meaning: for one to place themselves behind another, as making a line.
to cut firewood.
to pinch someone.

spanish_meaning: hacer ruido un árbol al caer.
english_meaning: for a tree to make noise upon falling.

spanish_meaning: hacer sonar el piso al golpearlo con una vara o un objeto similar, tal como se hacía tradicionalmente en algunas danzas iskonawas.
english_meaning: for the floor to make noise upon a stick or similar object hitting it, such as those traditionally made for some iskonawa dances.
for the heart to beat.

spanish_meaning: cavar un hueco o una zanja.
english_meaning: to dig a hollow or a trench.

spanish_meaning: picar el cuerpo por mordeduras de insectos, isangos, entre otros.
english_meaning: for one’s body to itch because of insects, isangos (mites), among others.

spanish_meaning: empezar algo alguien (como un trabajo) o iniciarse un proceso de manera espontánea.
english_meaning: to carry.
for someone to start something (as a job) or begin a process in a spontaneous way.
to begin to get light.
to eat.

spanish_meaning: flechar, disparar una flecha a una persona o animal.
english_meaning: to wound with an arrow, to shoot an arrow at a person or an animal.
to cook something with fire.
to feed, to give food.
to shake by exhaustion.

spanish_meaning: gruñir; por ejemplo, el tapir o sachavaca.
english_meaning: to growl; for example, the tapir or sachavaca
to shoot something or someone
to tickle.

spanish_meaning: juntar varios objetos amarrándolos con una pita o soga.
english_meaning: to bring various objects together, fastening them with a thin cord or rope.

spanish_meaning: propagarse el olor de algo usualmente desagradable; apestar.
english_meaning: for the smell of something usually disagreeable to spread; to stink
to hang something on a wall.

spanish_meaning: hincar a una persona con una vara corta.
english_meaning: to pound a person with a short stick.
to defecate.
to stretch something.

spanish_meaning: caer el agua en una catarata o caída de agua.
english_meaning: for the water in a waterfall to fall.
to inflate something through blows.

spanish_meaning: abandonar algo; por ejemplo, una casa.
english_meaning: to neglect something; for example, a house.

spanish_meaning: tirar o arrojar algo; por ejemplo, arrojar la basura.
english_meaning: to throw or toss something; for example, to throw the trash away
to gut, disembowl.
to drizzle.

spanish_meaning: expulsar o producir vapor debido a una alta temperatura.
english_meaning: to eject or produce vapor due to a high temperature

spanish_meaning: soplar ligeramente el viento, como una brisa.
english_meaning: for the wind to blow lightly, as a breeze.
to advise someone.
to be ashamed.

spanish_meaning: avergonzarse mucho, al punto de que el rostro adquiere un color rojo.
english_meaning: to be very ashamed, at the point that the face acquires a red color.
to sand down wood.
to lie on one’s back.
to reject something or someone.

spanish_meaning: recostar a alguien. Por ejemplo, a un bebé o a un enfermo.
english_meaning: to lie someone on their back. For example, a baby or an invalid.

spanish_meaning: comer algo royendo, como lo hacen los ratones.
english_meaning: to eat something gnawing, as the mice do.

spanish_meaning: curar a una persona empleando plantas medicinales; hacerle daño a una persona mediante brujería; en castellano regional, se dice pusanguear.
english_meaning: to cure a person employing medicinal plants; to wound a person through witchcraft; in regional Castilian, one says pusanguear.
to scare or get scared.
to scrape.
to growl.

spanish_meaning: sonar el viento muy fuerte, como un ventarrón.
english_meaning: for the wind to sound very strongly, as a strong wind/gale.
to have a runny nose; for the snot to spill.
to blow one’s nose.
to feel disgust.

spanish_meaning: cantar canciones tradicionales luego de una borrachera.
english_meaning: to sing traditional songs after drunkenness

spanish_meaning: aullar un perro o un lobo.
english_meaning: for a dog or wolf to howl.

spanish_meaning: colocarse adornos tradicionales en la nariz.
english_meaning: to smoke.
to place traditional ornaments in the nose.
to rock in a hammock.
to scatter.
to water, to spill somehting.

spanish_meaning: golpear a alguien lanzando un objeto; huicapear en el castellano regional.
english_meaning: to hit somone throwing an object; huicapear in regional Castilian.

spanish_meaning: seguir un régimen alimenticio restringido como parte de un tratamiento de medicina natural; dietar.
english_meaning: to follow a eating diet as part of a treatment of natural medicine; to diet.

spanish_meaning: apuntar a alguien con un objeto o con un arma, señalar.
english_meaning: to make a note to someone with an object or with a weapon, to mark.

spanish_meaning: bajar el sol luego del medio día.
english_meaning: for the sun to lower after midday.
to drizzle with fat drops.

spanish_meaning: ponerse ropa, algún adorno o joya.
english_meaning: to put on clothes, some ornament or jewel

spanish_meaning: enrollar una soga varias veces; doblar la ropa; enrrollarse una serpiente.
english_meaning: to roll up a rope various times; to fold clothes; for a serpant to roll up.

spanish_meaning: mezclar colores, líquidos, entre otras cosas.
english_meaning: to mix colors, liquids, among other things.
for a serpent to hiss.

spanish_meaning: quemar el sol muy fuerte cuando no hay viento.
english_meaning: for the sun to burn very strongly when there is not wind
to saw.

spanish_meaning: golpear a alguien con un objeto o arma, como un palo, cinturón o látigo.
english_meaning: to hit someone with an object or weapon, as a stick, belt, or whip.
to dry something.
to forget.
to think, remember

spanish_meaning: opinar, hacer pensar a otra persona.
english_meaning: to opine, to make another person think
to spill a liquid.
strong rain.
to crawl
to expel flatulence (farts).

spanish_meaning: chamuscar la piel de los animales para quitarles el pelo antes de cocinarlos.
english_meaning: to scortch the skin of animals to remove the hair before cooking them.
to swell or become inflamed.

spanish_meaning: limpiar algo con la mano, con un trapo o con un cuchillo.
english_meaning: to clean something with one’s hand, with a rag or with a knife.

spanish_meaning: limpiarse; por ejemplo, con una toalla.
english_meaning: to wash; for example, with a towel.

spanish_meaning: zumbar una abeja, avispa o mosca.
english_meaning: for a bee, wasp, or fly to buzz
to shake clothes and similar objects.
to shake off; for a serpent to jingle.
to paste something, to stick on.
to lick.
to hurt a part of the body.
to go with caution.
to try any food.
to roast yucca.

spanish_meaning: hacer un puente con palos para cruzar un río.
english_meaning: to make a bridge with sticks to cross a river.
to roll, to make roll.
to roll around.

spanish_meaning: estar lleno o satisfecho, dicho de una persona luego de haber comido.
english_meaning: to be full or satisfied, said of person after having eaten

spanish_meaning: crujir los dientes produciendo un ruido fuerte.
english_meaning: to grind one’s teeth producing a strong noise.
to slip.

spanish_meaning: tener mucha sed, sin acceso a ninguna fuente de agua.
english_meaning: to be very thirsty, without access to any source of water.
to clear one’s throat.
to tie with force, to tigthen.
for an insect to bite.
to get tongue-tied.
to break something.
for an injury to hurt, producing stabbing pains.

spanish_meaning: balancearse; moverse de un lado a otro como bailando.
english_meaning: to swing; to move from one side to the other as dancing.
to pull out
to push someone.
to hang someone.

spanish_meaning: excitarse, despertarse el deseo sexual en una persona.
english_meaning: to become aroused, to wake up the sexual desire in a person.
to touch.

spanish_meaning: tocar con el dedo varias veces, como hincando un punto específico.
english_meaning: to touch with the finger various times, as hammering a specific point
for the heart to beat.

spanish_meaning: masajear a alguien, como para curar una lesión.
english_meaning: to massage someone, as to cure an injury.

spanish_meaning: masajearse uno mismo, como para curarse una lesión.
english_meaning: to massage oneself, as for curing oneself of an injury.

spanish_meaning: dar de saltos, saltar en el mismo sitio.
english_meaning: to hop, to jump in the same spot.
to impregnante someone.

spanish_meaning: cargar (a un niño o a un animal); en el castellano regional se dice amarcar.
english_meaning: To carry (a child or an animal); in regional Castilian it is called amarcar.
to sift.
for a woman to become pregnant
to toast.
to beat against.

spanish_meaning: hacer sonar los huesos de la mano; sacarse conejos.
english_meaning: for the bones of the hand to make noise; to crack one’s knuckles.

spanish_meaning: partir algo en dos partes más o menos iguales.
english_meaning: to divide something in two parts more or less equal.
to drip.

spanish_meaning: colocar cosas al otro lado (del río, por ejemplo).
english_meaning: to place things on the other side (of the river, for example).
to knock making the wood sound.
to swim.
to count, to enumerate.
to spin cotton employing a spindle.

spanish_meaning: reventar. Por ejemplo, huevos y globos.
english_meaning: to burst. For example, eggs and balloons.

spanish_meaning: reventarse algo, como un huevo o una llanta.
english_meaning: To burst something, as an egg or a tire.

spanish_meaning: ser charlatán, hablar mucho, como engañando.
english_meaning: to be a charlatan, to talk a lot, as deceiving.
to walk stumbling

spanish_meaning: lanzar varios objetos a una persona o animal con el objetivo de herirlo.
english_meaning: to throw various objects at a person or an animal with the objective of injuring it.
to place something above a surface
to get; yo take out.

spanish_meaning: arrancar una rama de un árbol o arbusto.
english_meaning: to uproot a branch of a tree or a bush.

spanish_meaning: pintar diseños tradicionales en el cuerpo de una persona, como lo hacían tradicionalmente los iskonawas.
english_meaning: to paint traditional designs on the body of a person, as the Iskonawas traditionally did.
to kiss someone.
to pinch someone.
to make a plot of land.
to row.

spanish_meaning: temblar de frío o de miedo.
english_meaning: to tremble out of cold or out of fear.
to rip fabric or paper.

spanish_meaning: rasgar varias veces ropa o papel.
english_meaning: to rip articles of clothing or paper various times.

spanish_meaning: salpicar agua a alguien; lloviznar con gotas menudas.
english_meaning: to splash water on someone; to drizzle with diminute drops.
to hit strongly.

spanish_meaning: arder la piel como producto de una infección o problema en la piel.
english_meaning: for the skin to burn because of an infection or a problem of skin.

spanish_meaning: abanicar algo o a alguien usando una hoja de palmera o algo similar.
english_meaning: to fan something or someone using a palm leaf or something similar.
to fan oneself.
to get angry.
to move something in a circular manner.
to hook.
to push something or someone

spanish_meaning: empujar varias veces algo o a alguien.
english_meaning: to push something or somone various times.

spanish_meaning: empujarse dos dos personas, como en una pelea de lucha libre.
english_meaning: for two people to push each other, as in a wrestling match.
to be dirty.
to row.

spanish_meaning: excitarse los órganos sexuales de una persona o un animal.
english_meaning: for the sexual organs of a person or an animal become aroused.

spanish_meaning: moverse pendularmente, estar suelta una madera de una casa.
english_meaning: to move like a pendulum, for the wood of a house to be loose.
to complain strongly.
to sow corn.

spanish_meaning: no estar en un lugar una persona, un animal o un objeto; haberse acabado un producto.
english_meaning: for a person, animal or object not to be in a place; to having run out of a product.
to advise.
to count something
to be selfish or miserly.
to question, to ask.
to fly.

spanish_meaning: embrujar a una persona a través de un chamán.
english_meaning: to bewitch a person through a shaman.
to kill.
lacking, feeling the lack of.
be bothered (with)
be annoyed
worry (about)
to loathe, to detest
to think, to miss, to love
to jump
